values.ctor:
<init>(port: Int)
            Creates a socket address where the IP address is the wildcard address and the port number a specified value.

<init>(addr: InetAddress!, port: Int)
            Creates a socket address from an IP address and a port number.

<init>(hostname: String!, port: Int)
            Creates a socket address from a hostname and a port number.

values.desc: Creates an unresolved socket address from a hostname and a port number.
Compares this object against the specified object.
Returns the hostname, or the String form of the address if it doesn't have a hostname (it was created using a literal).
Returns a hashcode for this socket address.
Checks whether the address has been resolved or not.
Constructs a string representation of this InetSocketAddress.
